@graph.name: 1 Bowl Vegan Zucchini Bread - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: This delicious vegan zucchini bread is moist, fluffy and easy to make in 1 bowl! A perfect way to use up leftover zucchinis.

@graph.name: 1 Bowl Vegan Zucchini Bread
@graph.description: This delicious vegan zucchini bread is moist, fluffy and easy to make in 1 bowl! A perfect way to use up leftover zucchinis.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup canola oil (| may sub melted coconut oil or vegan butter, or applesauce for oil free)
1 cup grated zucchini (| about 1 medium zucchini)
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour (| or white whole wheat)
optional: 1 cup dairy free chocolate chips or chopped walnuts

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard loaf pan (9 x 5 inch) with parchment paper or spray with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard loaf pan (9 x 5 inch) with parchment paper or spray with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add the oil, almond milk, ground flaxseeds, brown sugar and vanilla. Whisk well until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, add the oil, almond milk, ground flaxseeds, brown sugar and vanilla. Whisk well until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly blot the grated zucchini with paper towels, and add it to the bowl. Stir the zucchini into the wet ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly blot the grated zucchini with paper towels, and add it to the bowl. Stir the zucchini into the wet ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the flour to the wet ingredients. Sprinkle the baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon on top of the flour. Stir gently until just combined, being careful not to over mix, or your loaf will be dense.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the flour to the wet ingredients. Sprinkle the baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon on top of the flour. Stir gently until just combined, being careful not to over mix, or your loaf will be dense.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the walnuts or chocolate chips, if using. Pour into the prepared pan, and bake for 45-55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the walnuts or chocolate chips, if using. Pour into the prepared pan, and bake for 45-55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Let it cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer the loaf to parchment paper or a cooling rack. Slice carefully right away, or let cool completely for easier slicing and serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Let it cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer the loaf to parchment paper or a cooling rack. Slice carefully right away, or let cool completely for easier slicing and serving.

@graph.keywords: vegan quick bread, vegan zucchini bread
